{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3421659,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-07T17:37:01.206Z","cooked":"

“Limelight 3a” is the only vision coprocessor officially allowed for the new FTC Season, as mentioned here.
However, no information (size, appearance, mounting method, capabilities…) about it has been announced on their product page.
Does anyone know anything relevant to this potential game-changer?

catrix:

…However, no information (size, appearance, mounting method, capabilities…) about it has been announced…

LimeLight 3A CAD models can be found on LimeLights Downloads Page (scroll down to the “CAD” section).

They also have FTC Pipeline information on the Documentation page.

I read that as the only “programable” vision coprocessor allowed. Huskylens should still be allowed as it doesn’t need to be reprogrammed to detect april tags.

Edit: Yes I did look it up. Under the change document, the new R703, orange box example 2 explicitly calls out the Huskylens and Pixy2 as vision coprocessors that are configurable but not programmable and points you back to R702 for further clarification on not altering coprocessor software. The end of the orange box points you to R715 for more information on vision coprocessors.

R715 allows vision 7devices natively supported by the robot controller. Huskylens support was added to the SDK in 2023 and never removed. It detects april tags without reprogramming.

Limelight does not appear to be the “only” vision coprocessor available.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-08T04:00:45.187Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":37,"reads":313,"readers_count":312,"score":262.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":470890,"topic_slug":"limitlight3a-for-new-ftc-season","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57083,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limitlight3a-for-new-ftc-season/470890/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3421809,"name":"guineawheek","username":"guineawheek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/guineawheek/{size}/180797_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T04:56:55.721Z","cooked":"

One key difference in FTC is that unlike the roboRio, the Control Hub is reasonably capable at running OpenCV and AprilTags at usable framerates with USB webcams.

The benefit of Limelight here is if you already have expertise in its stack from FRC or feel that the official VisionPortal with a USB webcam is inadequate.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-08T04:56:55.721Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":156.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":470890,"topic_slug":"limitlight3a-for-new-ftc-season","display_username":"guineawheek","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://ftc-docs.firstinspires.org/en/latest/apriltag/vision_portal/visionportal_overview/visionportal-overview.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"VisionPortal Overview — FIRST Tech Challenge Docs 0.2 documentation","clicks":35}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31855,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"software @ redux robotics"},"post_url":"/t/limitlight3a-for-new-ftc-season/470890/6","custom_user_title":"software @ redux robotics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3421815,"name":"","username":"rwwin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/6de8d8/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-08T05:32:49.796Z","cooked":"

My point isn’t if there’s benefit to the limelight, it’s that it isn’t the only viable route for reliable vision sensing. The currently available Huskylens appears to still be legal and is a good “out of the box” solution for finding april tags at less than a third the price of the still unavailable FTC version of the limelight.
